sense.name: hit with or as if with a hammer, often repeatedly
sense.examples: After much fussing, he hammered in two thin pitons thirty feet up. With two outs in the third, he hammered a pitch from the Potomac starter. He hammered down walls of injustice. My third-grade teacher hammered the times tables into my head.

sense.name: create by hammering
sense.examples: And upon this shield he hammered out images that were a wonder to men. He hammered out the President's heads on Mt. Rushmore.

sense.name: discuss vehemently and create an agreement
sense.examples: The couple reportedly have hammered out a prenuptial agreement. A global cyber-crime treaty has been hammered out. A farm bill will be hammered out in the coming months.
